results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Education Development Center, Quentin Brown and Kevin Smith
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. This film show life at the campsite. Children amuse themselves with makeshift toys. Women tend their children, make clothes, and repair the igloos. When the men return with their catch, everyone goes inside where work, story-telling and games occupy each one’s time. Award: Parno. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Education Development Center, Quentin Brown and Kevin Smith
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. In late winter when the cold is severe, the inuit stop their trek and make camp. The men cut blocks for an igloo while the women shovel the site. During the day, the men sit patiently on the ice, waiting for seals. (Award: Parno)

results.title: At the turn of the age: Hans Holbein the younger 1497-1543
results.creator_credit: Filmstudio Walter Leckebusch, Walter Leckebusch and Herbert E. Meyer
results.brief_description: Deals with aspects of the Renaissance and concentrates on the development of Holbein’s painting, drawing and etching. Holbein, a court painter, and a prime example of the new breed of man who could move out of the restrictive boundaries of his homeland to achieve fame and wealth in foreign courts and cities.
results.title_for_label: At the turn of the age: Hans Holbein the younger 1497-1543

results.title: At the threshold of eternity
results.creator_credit: Colorado State University Production Company and Mikel Way
results.brief_description: Dr. James Enderson talks about the ways being used to save endangered or threatened wildlife. The following recovery plans: Habitat Management, Transplanting, and Captive Breeding, are shown in practice with wildlife in several areas of the United States.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colorado State University Production Company and Mikel Way

results.title: At the spring sea ice camp. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Quentin Brown and Kevin Smith
results.brief_description: Netsilik Inuit Eskimo families travel across the sea ice. Before night falls, they build igloos. A boy practices spear throwing at a figure built in the snow while a woman crimps the sole of a sealskin boot.

results.title: At the sign of the owl
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Herschells Films, R. Maslyn Williams and Colin Dean
results.brief_description: Surveys the activities of the Council of Adult Education in organising cultural activities throughout Victoria, showing particularly the annual Summer School conducted at Albury. The school extends over ten days and provides opportunities for the study of art and crafts, music, opera and drama.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Herschells Films, R. Maslyn Williams and Colin Dean

results.title: At the height of summer = Vertical ray of the sun = Mua he chieu thang dung
results.creator_credit: Jerry Zucker, Studio Canal+, Arte France, ZDF Arte, Hang Phim Truyen, Christophe Rossignon and Tran Anh Hung
results.brief_description: Tran Anh Hung’s “At the Height of Summer” conveys the complexity and beauty of life in a completely unsentimental and un-moralistic manner. The story centres on a trio of sisters who live in contemporary Hanoi and whose closeness reflects the sanctity of the family. The duration of the story is one month and is framed by the celebration of their mother and father’s death anniversaries respectively. Beneath the surface of familial tranquillity and calmness, however, lies a sea of anxiety and instability. The elder sister is married to a husband who harbours a shocking secret; the middle sister questions her husband’s loyalty just as they are beginning a family; and the youngest sister, a strong and idealistic woman, experiences unrequited love whilst having a strong affinity for her brother that is only shades away from being a true relationship. Although “At the Height of Summer” does not contain the same overt political references as “Cyclo”, the same stylistic flair evident in that film continues here. Almost every shot in “At the Height of Summer” is filled with the abundant surface beauty of the world. From facial close-ups of the elegant sisters to a ray of light to a pelter of rain to a dead chicken’s hand to the passing of time, Hung captures the sensuousness of everyday Hanoi in a riveting, truly compelling manner. And in this way, his film assumes an air of poetry and lyricism that lends its subject-matter a sense of profound humility. Cast includes Tran Nu Yen-Khe, Nhu Quynh Nguyen, Chu Hung, Le Tuan Anh. In Vietnamese with English subtitles.

results.title: At the front: 1939-1945
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and Annice Vass
results.brief_description: A compilation of Cinesound and Movietone Newsreels featuring footage from World War II including Prime Minister Robert Menzies’ declaration of war in 1939, the AIF at Benghazi, the Coral Sea Victory, the Australian Women’s Army Service and other momentous events including famous war footage shot by Damian Parer.

results.title: At the foot of Mt Fuji
results.brief_description: A day in the life of a ten year old child who lives in a small town at the base of Mt Fuji in Japan, is revealed in his letter to a pen pal in the United States. Suitable for Early-Middle Primary students. No other credits available.
